block.block_description: Import content from any public RSS feed
Displays a welcome block to the logged in user, or a login form if the user is a guest
Pull member data from your site
Display the active users on the board

block.block_content: This is a custom block that can be reused in any page or template. This is useful for site messages, advertising, or even including specialist CSS files on specific pages. Try editing this block from your Admin CP and notice how it automatically updates on all pages it is used on!

block.block_description: Pull member data from your site
This block is a simple variable that maps to the img_url setting in IPB
This block is a simple variable that maps to the img_url setting in IPB

template.template_content:
{parse block="welcome"}

Recent Members

{parse block="members"}

Top Posters

{parse block="topposters"}

Active Users

{parse block="activeusers"}

Custom Block Demo

{parse block="custom"}
{ccs special_tag="page_content"}
© 2009 IPS, Inc.

page.page_description: The complete CSS for the demo site

page.page_content:
Welcome!

Welcome to IP.Community Content System! This is a simple demo site that shows you just a few of the things that you can accomplish using IP.CCS - pulling in data from inside and outside of your community, page templates and more.


See a different style of page →

RSS News from IPS

{parse block="ipsnews"}

page.page_description: Shows a page using the IPB wrapper
page.page_content:
Welcome

This page demonstrates using the IP.Board wrapper for your IP.CCS pages. This option is set on a per-page basis, so you can have some pages using the IP.Board wrapper, and others using a totally custom wrapper!

Because the IP.Board wrapper is included, all of the IP.Board JS and CSS files are included too, so you can reuse styles without any additional work.



Reusing our custom block...

{parse block="custom"}

  • Back to the main demo page

tblock.tpb_content:
Welcome, {$this->memberData['members_display_name']}!

Posts: {parse format_number="$data['posts']"}
Topics: {parse format_number="$data['topics']"}
Group: {$data['group']}
Joined: {parse date="$this->memberData['joined']" format="joined"}
My Profile · My Settings · {$this->memberData['msg_count_new']} Messages
{$this->lang->words['welcome_login_link']} {$this->lang->words['or']} {$this->lang->words['welcome_register_link']}

{parse striping="feed_striping" classes="row1,row2 altrow"}
  • {$r['title']}
    {IPSText::truncate( strip_tags($r['content']), 150 )} {parse date="$r['date']" format="short"}

{parse striping="feed_striping" classes="row1,row2 altrow"}
  • {$r['title']}
    {parse date="$r['date']" format="short"} {IPSText::truncate( strip_tags($r['content']), 32 )}

This is a custom block that can be reused in any page or template. This is useful for site messages, advertising, or even including specialist CSS files on specific pages. Try editing this block from your Admin CP and notice how it automatically updates on all pages it is used on!

{parse striping="feed_striping" classes="row1,row2 altrow"}
  • {$r['title']} ({$r['posts']} posts)
    {parse date="$r['date']" format="short"} {IPSText::truncate( strip_tags($r['content']), 32 )}
